snippet: Many in the Korean-American community in Queens voiced outrage that the restaurant had appeared to disrespect several older Korean people who treat a neighborhood branch like their living room.
abstract: Korean community leaders call for 'worldwide' boycott of McDonald's after residents in Flushing, Queens, voiced outrage that restaurant had appeared to disrespect several older Korean people; management of McDonald's franchise in Flushing had called 911 to oust group of older Korean men and women who sit for many hours every day hovering over a single cup of coffee, while potential customers choose to leave due to lack of seating.

byline.original: By SARAH MASLIN NIR and JIHA HAM

lead_paragraph: Many in the Korean-American community in Queens voiced outrage that the restaurant had appeared to disrespect several older Korean people who treat a neighborhood branch like their living room.

headline.main: Korean Community Leaders Urge McDonald’s Boycott
headline.print_headline: Leaders Urge Customers to Boycott McDonald’s
